metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6249 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in kernel mode layerhandler where a NULL pointer dereference may lead to denial of service orpotential escalation of privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6249` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcuda1-375 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcuda1-384 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-375 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-384 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-libopencl1-375 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-libopencl1-384 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-375 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-384 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nvidia-graphics-drivers-304: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
